modules.description: This module constructs file paths and URLs for JavaScript, CSS, and theme assets using a base directory and the `(/)` operator, alongside string constants for theme identifiers like white, black, and night. It works with string-based paths and theme names to support resource inclusion in HTML templates or dynamic asset loading. These values configure presentation styling and integrate external dependencies in web-based slide decks.

This module directly manipulates the DOM to build and configure HTML-based presentations. It provides functions to create slides, sections, and presentation metadata such as title, theme, and scripts. Concrete use cases include embedding CSS, generating slide content from a list of slide data, and initializing reveal.js presentations with custom configurations.

This module configures and initializes a presentation framework with options to control navigation, appearance, and behavior. It defines a configuration record with boolean flags and settings for transitions, slide timing, and display features. Use it to customize presentation settings like auto-sliding, touch support, and fragment visibility before starting the presentation.

This module enables constructing and customizing presentation slides with configurable transitions, themes, and content elements like titles, text, and lists. It manipulates slide properties such as speed, color, and transition effects, converting them into string-based configurations for rendering. Key applications include creating dynamic transitions (e.g., convex, fade), structuring presentations with pauses, and loading slide content from external files.

This module assembles and configures web-based presentations through precise manipulation of HTML structure, styling, and presentation logic. It constructs asset paths, defines slide content and transitions, and initializes presentation settings for reveal.js. Concrete applications include generating themed slides with dynamic content, embedding scripts and styles, and configuring navigation and display behavior for live presentations.
